alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 4:37AM CDT until July 12 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Ouachita County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 630 AM CDT. * At 437 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen since midnight...with the heaviest rainfall across far southwest Ouachita county south of Stephens. While the heaviest rainfall has ended...it may take some time for this water to run off. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stephens, Louann, Buena Vista, Elliot, Kirkland, Frenchport, Troy, Cross Roads in Ouachita County and Standard Umpstead. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
